title: 114_s2475
content: The "Federal Courts of Appeals Modernization Act" establishes a Commission on Structural Alternatives for the Federal Courts of Appeals, composed of 5 members appointed by the Chief Justice of the United States. The Commission will elect a chair and vice chair from its members, with three members needed to constitute a quorum. The Commission established by the "Federal Courts of Appeals Modernization Act" will study the division of the United States courts of appeals, focusing on the Ninth Circuit, and submit recommendations to the President and Congress for changes in circuit boundaries or structure to improve the efficiency of caseload disposition while upholding fairness and due process. SEC. 5. COMMISSION PERSONNEL MATTERS. Members of the Commission will be compensated at a rate of $300 per day for their duties. Officers or employees of the US government will serve without additional compensation. Travel expenses will be provided based on specified rates. SEC. 6. STAFF. The Commission may appoint an executive director compensated at a rate not exceeding the daily equivalent of a GS-15 position. The Executive Director can appoint additional personnel without following certain regulations, with pay not exceeding the annual rate. The Commission may appoint an executive director at a rate not exceeding the annual maximum rate of basic pay for a position above GS-15. The Executive Director can procure temporary services of experts or consultants at rates not greater than the daily equivalent of a comparable position under the General Schedule. The Administrative Office of the United States Courts shall provide administrative and financial services to the Commission on a reimbursable basis, while the Federal Judicial Center shall provide research services on a reimbursable basis. The Commission can request information and assistance from US departments, agencies, and independent bodies. They must conduct a study on specified issues within 10 months of having a quorum and submit a report to the President and Congress within 60 days. The Commission's functions will terminate after completing its tasks. SEC. 9. TERMINATION. The Commission will end 90 days after submitting the report. SEC. 10. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Up to $1,000,000 is authorized for this Act, available until spent.
